viewer module¶

class viewer.ImageViewer¶

Bases: builtins.object

Author:Sridhar Narayan
Version:1.1 - January 2015
Contact:narayans@uncw.edu
Organization:University of North Carolina Wilmington
Summary:Image viewer that supports display, modification, and saving of images in jpg, gif, png formats. User-written image processing functions can be loaded (added) into the viewer. These functions are then available for use as menu options. Multiple viewers can exist concurrently. An image displayed in one viewer can be accessed and modified by code invoked within the context of any other viewer.
static blank_image(width, height)¶

returns a blank (white) image with the specified dimension

Parameters:
  • width – width of the desired image (like 320)
  • height – height of the desired image (like 240)
Returns:

blank (white) image with the specified dimensions

get_pixel(x, y)¶

return a r,g,b-triple corresponding to the red,green,blue intensities of pixel at specified location (x,y) within the referenced viewer instance

Parameters:
  • x – the x coordinate of a location in the image
  • y – the y coordinate of a location in the image
Returns:

a triple corresponding to the red, green, blue intensities of the pixel at the specified (x,y) location within the referenced viewer instance
static get_viewer(viewer_id=None)¶

returns a reference to the ImageViewer instance identified by the viewer id. If no viewer id is specified, it returns a reference to the current, i.e. active, ImageViewer instance

Parameters:viewer_id – id of desired ImageViewer
Returns:reference to desired ImageViewer instance

set_pixel(x, y, r, g, b)¶

assign r,g,b values to pixel at specified location (x,y) within the referenced viewer instance

Parameters:
  • x – the x coordinate of a location within the referenced viewer instance
  • y – the y coordinate of a location within the referenced viewer instance
  • r – the red intensity of that pixel (0..255)
  • g – the green intensity of that pixel (0..255)
  • b – the blue intensity of that pixel (0..255)
Returns:

None
